thread.title: Gucci Was the Real Winner at the 2017 Grammy Awards
thread.title_full: Gucci Was the Real Winner at the 2017 Grammy Awards

title: Gucci Was the Real Winner at the 2017 Grammy Awards
text:
Gucci Was the Real Winner at the 2017 Grammy Awards Kevork Djansezian Twitter The Italian brand's wares were all over music's biggest names. 
The 2017 Grammys had its fair share of memorable moments, but there was one particular winner of the evening that didn't even take home an awardâ€” Gucci . To be clear, we're not talking Gucci Mane (who still, somehow, remains Grammy-less), but the Gucci that belongs to Alessandro Michele and his high-octane designs. The Italian brand's wares were spotted on stage, on the red carpet, and on artists of all genres all night long. There were Gucci suits, T-shirts, dresses, and even a couple of adorable kids-sized tuxedos. Let's check out of a few of our favorite Gucci looks from the night here. 
James Corden (and Blue Ivy Carter) 
Though James came through in one of his many looks with this back embroidery Gucci tuxedo, it's fair to say he got majorly upstaged by Blue Ivy Carter's pink tuxedo (also worn by another music world offspring, Schoolboy Q's daughter ) 
Magnus Larrson of Lukas Graham 
Gucci's designs these days are so bold that you don't even need a proper tuxedo (or even a jacket) to stand out. 
John Legend 
Lil Yachty 
For his first Grammys appearance, the rapper doubled down on swervy Gucci pieces, starting with an embroidered neck bow on the red carpet and ending the night in a yellow tipped blazer with tiger embroidery at Chance the Rapper and GQ 's after party. 
Jarobi White of A Tribe Called Quest 
Mike Will Made It 
But by far the most recognizably "New Gucci" look of the evening went to producer Mike Will Made It, who wore all Gucci and even carried a Gucci briefcase. Watch Now: Get Inside the Studio with Chance the Rapper
